title: Social mobilization and social marketing to promote NaFeEDTA-fortified soya sauce in an iron-deficient population through a public-private partnership
authors: Wang B, Zhan S, Sun J, Lee L
population: Women older than 20 years of age and young children aged from 3 to 7 years
intervention: Social mobilization and social  marketing of iron fortified soya sauce
outcomes-bf:
After 1 year, most knowledge and attitudes had changed positively
towards the prevention and control of anaemia.
outcomes-behavior: The percentage of women who adopted NaFeEDTA-fortified soya sauce increased from 8.9% to 36.6%.
outcomes-health: After 2 years, Hb levels had increased substantially, by 9.0 g/l in adult women and 7.7 g/l in children
smbc: 6: Behavior, Customer orientation, Insight, Exchange, Competition, Methods mix

title: Social Marketing Improved the Consumption of Iron-fortified Soy Sauce among Women in China
authors: Sun X, Guo Y, Wang S, Sun J
journal: Journal of Nutrition Education and Behavior, 2007, 39 (6): 302-310
intervention: Mall media compaign to promote use of Iron -fortified soy sauce (FeSS)
outcomes-bf: Knowledge  of the characteristics of FeSS, Perceptions, attitudes, intentions, availabilty of FeSS
outcomes-behavior: Compared with the baseline survey, the rates of eating and purchasing FeSS increased significantly in both rural areas and urban areas in the follow-up survey. The increases in the 2 experimental groups were significantly higher than those of the 2 control groups
smbc: 7: Behavior, Customer, Theory, orientation, Insight, Segmentation, Exchange, Competition, Methods mix

title: Industry Experience in Promoting Weekly Iron-Folic Acid Supplementation in the Philippines
authors:
Garcia J, Datol-Barrett E,
Dizon M
intervention: Social marketing of a weekly iron-folic acid supplement for  pregnant and non-pregnant women under the brand name  Femina
outcomes-behavior: In the pilot, of the  40% who had heard of Femina, 44%  tried the product, and 59% used the product often
smbc: 6:  Behavior, Customer orientation, Insight, Competition, Segmentation, Methods mix

title: Community Mobilization and Social Marketing to Promote Weekly Iron-Folic Acid Supplementation: A New Approach Toward Controlling Anemia Among Women of Reproductive Age in Vietnam
authors: Khan NC, Thanh HTK, Berger J, Hoa PT, Quant ND, Smitasiri S, Cavalli-Sforza T
intervention: Intervention using social marketing to increase use of Iron-Folic acid tablets and KAP of anemia, including free  distribution to pregnant women
outcomes-bf: Changes in knowledge and attitudes about anemia, buying practices increased from 54.5% to 92% among non pregnant women

title: Weekly Iron-Folic Acid Supplements to Prevent Anemica among Cambodian Women in Three settings: Process and Outcomes of Social Marketing and Community Mobilization
authors: Kanal K, Busch-Hallen J, Cavalli-Sforza T, Crape B, Smitasiri S
population: Women of reproductive age/secondary schoolgirls/garment factory workers/ rural village women
intervention: Social marketing mobilization program to promote Iron-Folic Acid supplement use and educate women about Anemia
outcomes-bf: Improved knowledge, attitudes, and beliefs about iron tablets at follow up
smbc: 5: Behavior, Customer orientation, Insight, Segmentation, Methods mix

title: Weekly Iron-Folic Acid Supplementation of Women of Reproductive Age: Impact Overview, Lessons Learned, Expansion Plans, and Contributions Toward Achievement of the Millennium Development Goals
authors: Cavalli-Sforza T, Berger J, Smitasiri S, Viteri F
intervention: Using social marketing to promote weekly Iron-Folic acid supplements through IEC materials and events.
outcomes-bf: Understanding of anemia and iron folic acid supplements incrased in all three countries
outcomes-behavior: Use of weekly iron folic  acid supplements
outcomes-health: In Vietnam Iron deficiency and iron deficiency anaemia significantly decreased among non pregant WRA taking weekeing iron folic acid supplements; in Phillipines significant improvments in  serum ferritin among pregnant and non pregnant women taking weeking iron-folic acid supplements; In Cambodia,  Hb levels increased among school girls but not among working or rural  women

title: Social Marketing Improved the Use of Multivitamin and Mineral Supplements among Resource-Poor Women in Bolivia
authors: Warnick E, Dearden KA, Slater S, Butr√≥n B, Lanata CF, Huffman SL
journal: Journal of Nutrition Education and Behavior, 2004, 36 (6): 290-297
intervention: Social marketing campaign for  multivitamin and mineral supplements, including VitalDia, using radio and television spots
outcomes-bf:
Increase in awareness of multivitamins, including VitalDia, the brand promoted as part of this
social marketing campaign
outcomes-behavior:
After 9 months
of social marketing, 11% of women had taken VitalDia one
or more times, 7% had taken it at least once in the last
3 months, and 4% had used it one or more times in the last
month
smbc: 7: Behavior, Theory, Customer orientation, Insight, Exchange, Segmentation, Methods mix

title: Involving husbands in safe motherhood: effects of the SUAMI SIAGA campaign in Indonesia
population: Primary audience: Men of reproductive age; Secondary audience: married women  of reproductive age, community leaders and groups,  midwives
intervention: Mass Media Campaign: PSA  Television, Radio Broadcast,  Print Material
outcomes-bf: Exposure to campaign, Changes in knowledge and information-seeking and information-sharing behaviors
outcomes-behavior: Percent of men reporting helping a women who was experiencing pregnancy complications
